title: Sourdough Farmhouse Bread
ingredients: 400 g rye flour (Type 997) for main dough
steps: For the sourdough: Mix rye flour, water, and active starter, let stand at room temperature for 15-17 hours.
Mix both flours in a bowl, make a well in the center.
Sprinkle salt and rye malt around the edge.
Optional: Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water and pour into the well.
Add sourdough and knead for 5-10 minutes.
Let rest for 30 minutes.
Knead vigorously, shape into rounds, and divide into two portions.
Place seam-side up in floured proofing baskets.
After 60 minutes, turn onto a peel, score the tops.
Slide into the oven preheated to 250°C.
Bake with strong steam for 15 minutes, then release steam.
Finish baking at 200°C for about 60 minutes.
Crack the oven door slightly 10 minutes before the end.
hints: The dough won't be sticky if kneaded properly.
Knock test: The bread should sound hollow when tapped on the bottom.
I don't use any yeast because my starter is very active.
Do the poke test to determine the right time to bake.

title: Chinese Fried Noodles with Chicken
steps: Soak noodles in warm water for about 15 minutes, then drain.
Cut chicken into small pieces, cook in salted water, and drain.
Heat oil in a hot wok, briefly fry the beaten egg, and scramble.
Add chopped onions and stir-fry briefly.
Add carrot strips and sliced leeks, stir-fry briefly.
Add noodles and fry, season with salt, sugar, and dark soy sauce.
Add chicken and bean sprouts, toss quickly in the heat.
Mix in white pepper and sesame oil, then serve.
hints: Everything must happen quickly – prep all ingredients beforehand!
Noodles should be cooked but not too soft.
Add sesame oil only at the very end.

title: Creamy Pasta Bake with Tomatoes and Mozzarella
steps: Finely dice onion and garlic, seed and finely chop chili.
Halve cherry tomatoes, grate Parmesan, dice mozzarella, pick basil leaves.
Bring salted water to a boil and cook pasta al dente.
Heat olive oil in a large pan, sauté onion, garlic, and chili.
Add passata and simmer for a few minutes.
Stir in cream and grated Parmesan.
Season with salt, pepper, and a generous pinch of sugar.
Drain pasta and add to the sauce.
Fold in cherry tomatoes, half the mozzarella, and basil.
Transfer to a baking dish, top with remaining mozzarella.
Bake at 200°C (conventional) for about 20 minutes until golden.
hints: A generous pinch of sugar is important for the tomato sauce!
Serve with green salad and garlic baguette.
Remove pan from heat before folding in the fresh ingredients.

title: Mini Potato Cordon Bleu

equipment: Deep fryer or pot with oil

steps: Cut ham into quarters.
Place ham and cheese on 2 tbsp potato pancake mix.
Cover with another 1 tbsp potato pancake mix.
Seal well.
Coat the patties in breadcrumbs.
Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown.
hints: Seal the patties well so the cheese doesn't leak out.
The oil should be hot enough (about 175°C).
Per portion: 220 calories, 11 g protein, 26 g carbohydrates, 11 g fat.

title: Grandma's Chicken Soup
steps: Wash the chicken legs.
Wash and chop the soup vegetables (carrots, celery, and leek).
Fill a large pot with cold water, add chicken legs, and bring to a boil.
Cook for 30-40 minutes depending on size.
Remove chicken legs.
Add chopped vegetables and noodles to the pot and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium, add allspice berries.
Remove meat from bones and shred.
After 10-15 minutes, return the meat to the soup.
Bring to a boil again and season with salt, pepper, and turmeric.
Remove allspice berries.
Add chopped parsley just before serving.
hints: Cooking time varies depending on the size of the legs (30-40 minutes).
The allspice berries usually float to the top and are easy to remove.
Add parsley just before serving.

title: Italian Pizza Dough

equipment: Rolling pin or hands for stretching

steps: Put all ingredients in a bowl.
Knead thoroughly for at least 5 minutes.
Let the dough rise for about 30 minutes.
Divide into 3-4 portions and shape into balls.
Roll out and add toppings.
hints: This dough makes 3-4 round pizzas or one sheet pan.
Oven: 220°C, about 15-20 minutes.
Pizza stone: 250°C, about 10-15 minutes.
Electric skillet: Level 3, first side 3 min, flip, add toppings, another 3 min.
This recipe came from an Italian friend.

title: Quick Flammkuchen (Tarte Flambée)
ingredients: Salt or seasoning salt and pepper
steps: Make a shortcrust dough from oil, water, salt, and flour.
Roll out very thin.
Mix sour cream and crème fraîche, season, and spread over the dough.
Microwave onions with a little water for 1 minute at 600 watts.
Distribute onions and bacon over the topping.
Bake at 250°C (conventional) on the lowest rack for 20 minutes.
Serve sprinkled with chive rings.
hints: This dough contains no yeast – making it especially quick!
Pre-cook onions in the microwave so they don't burn.
To save calories, replace crème fraîche with 20% quark.
